pair.Prompt: What was the case of FTC v. TICOR TITLE INS. CO. about?
pair.Response: Response: FTC v. TICOR TITLE INS. CO. was a case about whether state-action immunity applied to private price-fixing arrangements. The Court held that active state supervision was necessary for state-action immunity to apply, and that Wisconsin and Montana did not provide sufficient active supervision. The case was decided on June 22, 1992, with the Court citing 504 U.S. 621 (1992).
